p: Next, we analyzed the risk of pneumonia and the selected comorbidities. Patients who had received an influenza vaccination showed a 15% decreased risk of pneumonia (adjusted odds ratio (aOR) = 0.85, confidence interval (CI) = 0.79â€“0.93). Furthermore, patients had an increased risk of pneumonia with following comorbidities: hypertension, diabetes, cerebrovascular disease, renal disease, and liver disease ( Table 2).
